Body:
right now i'm using the following code:

string patch = {\"Device\": {\"DeviceState\": \"started\"
column11: my requirement is i want to update the same (reported properties) using IOT hub rest API
column12:
I read something like the following:

https://{{hubName}}.azure-devices.net/twins/{{deviceId}}?api-version=2016-11-14

A patch request to the above api with a json payload

Body: this is a service-facing endpoint, so it can be used only for changes on the tags and desired properties of the device twin. The device twin reported properties can be changed only from the device-facing endpoint.

the device twin on the device-facing side is supported only for connection oriented protocols such as AMQP and MQTT in the present time. In other words, there is no REST API endpoint on the device-facing side for device twin properties.
in the case of avoiding SDK library, I do recommend to use the MQTT protocol directly, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-mqtt-support#using-the-mqtt-protocol-directly
can you please tell me which end point i need to use, i'm not much familiar with this.
